net.powermatcher.api

Interface Agent.Status

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AgentEndpoint.Status
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseAgentEndpoint.Connected, BaseMatcherEndpoint.Connected
    Enclosing interface:
    Agent

    public static interface Agent.Status
    The Agent.Status object describes the current connection status of an Agent. This status can be queried through the Agent.getStatus() method and will give a snapshot of the state at that time.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getClusterId() 
      MarketBasis getMarketBasis() 
      boolean isConnected()
      For a agent to be connect, the Agent.setContext(FlexiblePowerContext) has been called and the agent has been configured with a clusterId (and usually a market basis).

    • Method Detail

      • getClusterId

        java.lang.String getClusterId()
        Returns:
        the id of the cluster, as received from its Agent parent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the agent is not connected (see isConnected())

      • getMarketBasis

        MarketBasis getMarketBasis()
        Returns:
        the current MarketBasis on which this Agent is running and basing its Bids and Prices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the agent is not connected (see isConnected())

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        For a agent to be connect, the Agent.setContext(FlexiblePowerContext) has been called and the agent has been configured with a clusterId (and usually a market basis). Only if this is true should the agent be used normally. For an AgentEndpoint this means that it has been connected through a Session. For a MatcherEndpoint is can be connected simply by having a MarketBasis configured (e.g. for an Auctioneer).
        Returns:
        true when the agent is connected to the cluster.
